text: when it comes to stand-ups I think that
I find that people ramble a lot so when

start to ramble and a lot of the

it's easy for everyone to pay attention
to what you did yesterday and what
you're going to do tomorrow but like if
you're working a team that has more than

for you to pay attention to all these
small granular level of detail that
everyone has
So to avoid rambling and to avoid making
meetings long and unproductive what I'd
say is just get your camera on board
go from left to right
and then look at the test they're there
and as people whether they're blocked
whether they need any answers or if

is okay people don't need to tell you

you're gonna you're probably gonna
review the code anyway you don't need to
know all the granular detail of what

standards are made for people to get
blockers out of the way
in a way daily stand-ups what they do is
produce daily preemptive feedback when
I've spoken about the that Interruption
point on your operating system which
causes things to be stopped and
something else to run or something to be
for a process to be terminated or
something like that so that that's the

there's no need to start with
technobabble or whatever it is you just

things get shorter and more productive
